**Get a brief introduction about the markdown basics used to build this blog!**

A markup file is a text file with embedded commands.

These commands can be simple text formatting characters or complete *R scripts*. A *rmd*-file ("R-Markdown") is a mixture of R commands, normal text and formatting code.

For a cheat sheet on markdown/quarto basics, visit [this site](https://www.markdownguide.org/cheat-sheet/) or have a look on [the basic syntax](https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/) for additional information. Markdown commands for special formatting such as adding colors, embedding comments, videos or table of contents, can be found [here](https://www.markdownguide.org/hacks/#overview).
